questions.question:
Refer to Annex A, showing various EHSI displays and answer the following questions:
The displays marked A, B, C, and D are respectively:
The following table:
options: a. Plan, Map, ILS, VOR
b. VOR, ILS, Expanded ILS, Plan
c. Map, VOR, ILS, Plan
d. Map, ILS, Expanded VOR, Plan

questions.question: Refer to the display marked E and identify the correct statement:
options: a. The aircraft is closing the localizer from the right, heading $130^{\circ}M$ and is approaching the glide path from above
b. When established on the localizer the inbound heading will be $165^{\circ}M$
c. The aircraft's track is $165^{\circ}M$
d. The localizer centre line is $133^{\circ}M$

questions.question: On display D the track from ZAPPO to BANTU is:
On display C the centre of the weather returns is:
options: a. $106^{\circ}$ relative, 18 NM
b. $332^{\circ}$ relative, 13 NM
d. 30 NM left of track, 15 NM ahead

questions.question: The drawing below is shown on the (i)............. is displaying (ii)........... and (iii).......
options: a. (i) Primary Flight Display (ii) 600 kt TAS (iii) 200 ft RA
b. (i) Navigation Display (ii) 600 ft RA (iii) 200 ft DH
c. (i) EADI (ii) 600 ft Radio Altitude (iii) 200 ft Decision Height
d. (i) EHSI (ii) 600 kt GS (iii) 200 ft AGL

questions.question:
The following yellow symbol appears in place of the normal radio altitude display when:
RA
options: a. the selected radio altitude has been reached
b. the radio altitude needs re-setting on the EHSI
c. there is a failure of the radio altimeter
d. the aircraft descends below 1000 ft AGL.

questions.question: The following symbols A, C, and E are best described respectively as:
options: a. off route waypoint, airport, navigation aid
b. next waypoint, navigation aid, airport
c. off route waypoint, navigation aid, a navigation point making up selected route
d. active waypoint aircraft currently navigating to, navigation aid, off route waypoint

questions.question: When using EHSI, weather radar may be displayed on the following settings:
options: a. map, $VOR/ILS$
b. VOR/ILS, map, expanded plan
c. expanded map, VOR/ILS, plan
d. map, expanded $VOR/ILS$

questions.question: WXR display is controlled from:
options: a. captain's EHSI control only
b. co-pilot's EHSI control only
c. a special control panel
d. both captain's and co-pilot's EHSI control panels

questions.question: Decision height is adjusted and set on the:
options: a. flight management computer
b. HSI section of the EFIS control panel
c. ADI section of the EFIS control panel
d. ADI or HSI

questions.question: Weather may be displayed, with modern EFIS fitted, on:
options: a. the captain's CRT only
b. the co-pilot's CRT only
c. a special screen
d. on both the captain's and co-pilot's CRTS

questions.question: Airspeed is shown:
options: a. only on the captain's EHSI
b. on both EADIS
c. on both EHSIS
d. only on the flight management CRT

questions.question: With an EFIS flight director using IRS guidance, reference north can be:
options: a. magnetic north only.
b. magnetic north between $73^{\circ}N$ and $65^{\circ}S$ and true north above these latitudes
c. magnetic north between $65^{\circ}N$ and $73^{\circ}S$ and true north above these latitudes
d. magnetic north between $75^{\circ}N$ and $75^{\circ}S$ and true north above these latitudes

questions.question: Modes available for (EFIS) HSI on some units are:
options: a. airspeed and Mach
b. MAP and PLAN
c. VOR, ILS, MAP and AUTO TRIM
d. only from manometric sources

questions.question: The EFIS symbols for a navaid and en route waypoint are:
options: a. [Symbol of VOR navaid], [Symbol of star waypoint]
b. [Symbol of triangle], [Symbol of star waypoint]
c. [Symbol of triangle], +
d. [Symbol of star waypoint], [Symbol of triangle]

questions.question: An EFIS as well as having a control panel, symbol generators and a remote light sensor also has:
options: a. EADIS and EHSIs
b. EHSIs and altitude indicator
c. EADIs and EICAS
d. EADI and WXR display tubes
